content.html:
The tests also fail on my machine. The gazebo.sim.modelFile only returns the file name, so the model is never inserted in the world. You can use it to test that the model exists, but if you want to create a model, you can use the spawn method on the sim object:

const gz = require('../index')
const g = new gz.Gazebo()
g.sim.spawn("model://camera", 'cam')

PR #4 will allow you to call g.spawn instead of g.sim.spawn.
